answers.answer: Hi there.These findings are non-specific, meaning it will be very hard to ascertain the cause just by mere appearance.  The comment that this is due to microvascular ischemic change means that you may indeed have problems with the arteries, which can be caused by high blood pressure, diabetes, or high cholesterol levels.  MS can also present with these types of MRI findings.  I agree that you consult your doctor for this so that you can be worked up further for the conditions I mentioned above.Hoping for the best.  Regards.

question: Several small foci of increased T2 signal seen in the periventricular and subcortical white matter.  Most likely this is due to some microvascular iscfhemic change.  There is no midline shift or mass effect.  Ther is no abnormal enhancement.  Cranlocerebral junction is unremarkable.  Pituitary is normal in apperance.  The paranasal sinuses are unremarkable.  I have to go to the doctor tomorrow and want understand what the above means.  I have heard MS, harding of the arteries or possibly low throid?
title: MIR Scan results
